pageContext.claim: “It takes China about one month to produce as much steel as they produce in the United States in an entire year.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump complains repeatedly about Chinese steel flooding the United States. But only about two percent of the steel imported in the U.S. comes from China, compared to steel imported from U.S. allies such as Canada (16.5 percent), European Union (15.5 percent), Brazil (13.5 percent). South Korea (10 percent) and Mexico (9 percent).
